trans-unit.source: The metadata that enables a Web API project to be deployed as an API app is contained in an *apiapp.json* file and a *Metadata* folder.
trans-unit.target: The metadata that enables a Web API project to be deployed as an API app is contained in an *apiapp.json* file and a *Metadata* folder.

trans-unit.source: The default contents of the *apiapp.json* file resemble the following example:
trans-unit.target: The default contents of the *apiapp.json* file resemble the following example:

trans-unit.source: Notice the `apiDefinition` endpoint `/swagger/docs/v1`: by default, API app projects use the [Swashbuckle](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Swashbuckle) NuGet package to provide automatic [Swagger](http://swagger.io/) metadata generation.
trans-unit.target: Notice the `apiDefinition` endpoint `/swagger/docs/v1`: by default, API app projects use the [Swashbuckle](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Swashbuckle) NuGet package to provide automatic [Swagger](http://swagger.io/) metadata generation.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial you can accept the defaults.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial you can accept the defaults.

trans-unit.source: The [API app metadata](#api-app-metadata) section later in the tutorial explains how to customize this metadata.
trans-unit.target: The [API app metadata](#api-app-metadata) section later in the tutorial explains how to customize this metadata.
